definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: However, I kept looking at the floor, noticing that his pants were stained with mud.
sentences.chinese: 而我卻始終盯着地面，看見他的褲管上沾滿泥濘。

sentences.english: The competition organiser may provide additional starting number bibs to be placed on the competitor's trouser leg.
sentences.chinese: 主辦單位也可能提供號碼單安置在選手褲管上。

sentences.english: Andy rolled up his pants and then walked through the stream.
sentences.chinese: 安迪捲起褲管，然後涉過了小溪。

sentences.english: Perconte, what are you thinking of blousing your pants?
sentences.chinese: 派康提，你幹嘛摺你的褲管？

sentences.english: I have a place in her pants playing some more soap.
sentences.chinese: 我在褲管的地方多打了一些肥皂。
時尚界人士會“穿一條褲管的褲子”。

sentences.english: When she come up to me, I saw her trousers, and found the trousers was tied a knot at the place beneath her thighs.
sentences.chinese: 走近了，我看到她的褲管，從大腿處就打了結。
誰會穿只有一條褲管的褲子？

definition: to take off costume and makeup/bottom garment (trousers etc)
to keep up with the latest fashion
